>@UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.archetypes.Item.S8O1OZvahGgiY5Kr]{Battleflower}

When you make an @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.equipment.Item.AWo4DU0s18agsFtJ]{unarmed strike}, before the attack roll you can declare an attempt to stagger the target. If you hit, the target takes damage normally and must succeed at a Fortitude save or be @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.conditions.Item.aAQ6SW6iK0EVq8Ce]{staggered} for 1 round. You can attempt this strike a number of times per day equal to one-third your class level.

When declaring your staggering strike, you can choose a different effect depending on your level. At 12th level, you can render a target staggered for [[/r 1d6+1]]{1d6+1 rounds}. At 16th level, you can make a target permanently @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.conditions.Item.tOpF6qjnlnKc10t7]{blinded} or @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.conditions.Item.D8JvCEmOiWKe2UDx]{deafened}. At 20th level, you can render the target @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.conditions.Item.CvsDp0GvojxiF2jz]{stunned} for [[/r 1d6+1]]{1d6+1 rounds}. Effects from multiple hits donâ€™t stack, but they can extend the duration.
